item.title: TaskForge v1.0.0-beta Release
item.description: Our first public beta release of TaskForge with CLI, API, and config improvements.
item.content:encoded:
Today we're excited to ship TaskForge v1.0.0-beta‚Äîour first public beta release.

This release focuses on solidifying the core experience: projects, tasks, CLI, and API.

Highlights‚Äã

  • üß∞ New taskforge init flow with clearer prompts
  • ‚úÖ Improved task listing and filtering in the CLI
  • üîê API authentication and rate limiting now enabled by default
  • ‚öôÔ∏è Structured taskforge.config.json with environments support

Breaking changes‚Äã

warning

This beta includes a breaking change to the way projectId is handled in taskforge.config.json. If you previously edited projectId by hand, please read the Config File docs carefully before upgrading.

  • Projects created with older previews may need to be reinitialized.
  • The CLI now refuses to run if projectId is missing or mismatched.

API updates‚Äã

  • All endpoints are now served from https://api.taskforge.dev/v1.
  • Rate limits are enforced at 100 requests/minute per API key.
  • Error responses include consistent error and message fields.

See the API Overview for details and curl examples.

CLI updates‚Äã

  • taskforge task add now accepts --assignee and --due flags.
  • taskforge task list adds a --status filter.
  • taskforge --config lets you point to a specific config file.

Check out the CLI Usage guide to see all available commands.

What's next‚Äã

Over the coming weeks we'll be focusing on:

  • Smoother onboarding for new teams
  • Deeper integrations with CI providers
  • More examples and templates in the docs

If you try the beta, we'd love your feedback. Reach out via the Contact page and tell us how TaskForge fits into your workflow.

item.title: Welcome to TaskForge
item.description: Introducing TaskForge, a developer-first project management platform.
item.content:encoded:
Happy New Year‚Äîand welcome to TaskForge üéâ

TaskForge is a project management platform designed specifically for developers and technical teams. Instead of forcing you into a UI-only workflow, TaskForge meets you where you already work:

  • A clean, minimal web dashboard
  • A powerful CLI for automation
  • A simple, well-documented REST API

With TaskForge you can:

  • Spin up new projects in seconds
  • Manage tasks from your terminal or CI
  • Keep your team aligned without leaving your dev tools

If you're curious to try it out, start with the Quickstart and create your first project today.
